Issues.Title: fix(animations): Ensure elements are removed from the cache after leave animation.
Issues.Body:
This commit fixes a memory leak. 

`_namespaceLookup` was cleared before the call to `processLeaveNode()` which was using the lookup.
Without that lookup `clearElementCache()` wasn't called thus keeping a reference to the element.  

Fixes #24197 & #50533

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(animations): Ensure elements are removed from the cache after leave animation." (#50929)

Issues.Title: NgOptimizedImage : IMAGE_LOADER as Observable<string>|string
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

IMAGE_LOADER is great for static urls.
But imagine, as I do it, that your app is able to load an image from a server, or from IndexedDB.
In this case we manage the url in two different ways : 

1. the url is used to get the image from the server
2. the url is used to display a Blob, already loaded from IndexedDB, or elsewhere locally

In case 1, it's okay to get a string
In case 2, we need first to load the file from IndexedDB, then create a Blob, then use its urls as Observable<string>

### Proposed solution

It would be great that IMAGE_LOADER would be able to return string | Observable<string>. It would allow us to  take a dynamic runtime decision to choose the way to load an image, which is not always from a server, which can have different source depending on context.

### Alternatives considered

I created a custom Image component to manage almost the same things than NgOptimizedImage. But yes NgOptimizedImage is really great, there is only this missing part for me... and maybe other people.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "NgOptimizedImage : IMAGE_LOADER as Observable<string>|string" (#50928)

Issues.Title: Location.prepareExternalUrl does not prepend '/' if 'useHash' is enabled
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

common

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

According to https://angular.io/api/common/Location#prepareexternalurl, it is assumed that slash is prepended in cases when `useHash` (HashLocationStrategy) is enabled, but it doesn't happen.

`location.prepareExternalUrl('user')` results in `#/user` if `{useHash: true}`, but if `{useHash: false}` the result is  `/user` .
It is expected to be  `/#/user` as if it were normalized.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

Issues.Title: Specify extra effect dependencies without using them inside the effect function
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

Allow specifying dependencies without the need to call them inside the effect. That is needed whenever we need to react to a signal change without needing to use the value of that signal inside the effect. For example:
```javascript
// log the below message whenever a task is completed (assuming we have a `completedTasksCount` signal)
effect(() => {
    console.log("Congratulations on completing the task!!")
})
```

### Proposed solution

add `extraDependencies` to [CreateEffectOptions](https://angular.io/api/core/CreateEffectOptions). It will be a list of signals that trigger re-execution of the effect even though they are not used inside the effect.

```javascript
effect(() => {
    console.log("Congratulation on completing the task!!")
}, {extarDependencies: [completedTasksCount]})
```

I also thought this new option fits best as the last piece that complements what angular currently has:
- automatic tracking of signals used inside the effect
- ability to [untrack](https://angular.io/guide/signals#reading-without-tracking-dependencies) specific signals even though though they are used inside the effect


### Alternatives considered

#### Add `dependencies` to [CreateEffectOptions](https://angular.io/api/core/CreateEffectOptions).
The new option will handle both: untracking of signals used inside the effect and tracking of signals not used inside the effect. When `dependencies` is specified, angular should disable its default behavior and only track signals specified in `dependencies`. I actually think this is a better alternative if the feature is approved for implementation. That's because it provides one API for tracking and untracking as opposed to checking the `extraDependencies` to know what forces re-execution of the effect and checking the effect body to see which signals are wrapped inside `untracked`.

#### tracked(completedTasksCount)
much like there is `untracked(counter)`, add `tracked(counter)` to trigger re-execution of the effect. My problem with it is that it can be called anywhere inside the effect. So, there is no one place to check what forces re-execution of the effect.

#### Check other frontend libraries/frameworks
- Solidjs [on](https://www.solidjs.com/docs/latest/api#on): I went to check if solidjs has sth to deal with these use cases and `on` seemed to be the closest thing. To be honest, I didn't quite understand if it solves the same issue, so I'm only mentioning it here in case it's helpful.
- Preact [effect](https://github.com/preactjs/signals#effectfn): seems like it doesn't allow re-execution of the effect unless a signal is accessed.
- Svelte: the `$:` seems to re-execute only when one of the values referenced inside changes
- Qwik [useTask$](https://qwik.builder.io/docs/guides/qwik-nutshell/#usetask----): doesn't run into the problem because it is explicit about what the effect tracks `taskContext.track(() => page.value)`
- React `useEffect`: doesn't run into the problem because it is explicit about what the effect tracks through `dependencies`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Specify extra effect dependencies without using them inside the effect function" (#50916)

Issues.Title: Docs: FormControl not mentioned as subclass of AbstractControl
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

I was recently browsing through the docs for `AbstractControl` and I noticed that the first line states:

> This is the base class for [FormControl](https://angular.io/api/forms/FormControl), [FormGroup](https://angular.io/api/forms/FormGroup), and [FormArray](https://angular.io/api/forms/FormArray).

Yet, on the same page under [Subclasses](https://angular.io/api/forms/AbstractControl#subclasses), `FormControl` is not mentioned as a subclass. Perhaps I'm missing something here but this seems to contradict? As far as I can tell, `FormControl` is effectively a subclass of `AbstractControl`. 

If someone could confirm this is indeed a mistake, then I'd be happy to open a PR to fix it.

### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem

https://angular.io/api/forms/AbstractControl

Issues.Title: SSR Image is not defined
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When I use the image object on my SSR solution it does fail server side and the image does not get rendered although it gets displayed in the browser.

In order to reproduce the issue, clone the repo in the link and do:
1.- `npm run dev:ssr`
2.- navigate to `http://localhost:4200/image-issue`

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/CarlosTorrecillas/universal-issue

    at callHook (./node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:3868:13)

    at refreshView (./node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:12490:21)
    at detectChangesInView (./node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:12639:9)
    at detectChangesInEmbeddedViews (./node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:12583:13)
    at refreshView (./node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:12499:9)
    at detectChangesInView (./node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/core.mjs:12639:9)
```

Issues.Title: refactor: improve type safety of interpolation AST
Issues.Body: Instead of using `any`, we should use the actual types that are available from the parser.

Issues.Title: refactor(core): include DI path into cyclic dependency error message
Issues.Body:
This commit updates the logic to better handle a situation when there is a cyclic DI dependency detected. Previously, the error message used to contain the name of the token that triggered the problem. With this change, the DI resolution path would also be included, so that it's easier to find and resolve the cycle.

I'd like to credit @AndrewKushnir who did most of the work on this.

Fixes: #46189
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(core): include DI path into cyclic dependency error message" (#50902)

Issues.Title: refactor(localize): deprecate `@angular/localize/init`
Issues.Body:
The angular compiler uses the global $localize there is no need to export it. Also as `@angular/localize/init` is only a re-export, it can be deprecated to simplify the usage.

You can import `@angular/localize` directly now to expose `localize$` globally.

Fixed #48545

Issues.Title: Really slow serve time after upgrading from v15 to v16
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

v15.0.1

### Description

When I upgraded from angular 15 to 16 `ng serve` started crashing with out of memory exception. It also became really slow (I guess it has to do with the same thing due to GC happening more often?)

I fixed the crash by doing `node --max_old_space_size=8000 ./node_modules/@angular/cli/bin/ng serve` but it takes a lot of minutes to actually serve the app. In v15 I didn't have this problem at all and everything was much quicker.

For reference, in v15 it always takes about 3 minutes to serve, while on v16 it always takes around 6 minutes (I noticed that half of that is spent on the setup phase)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): normalize paths in loader cache with esbuild
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based application builder, some plugins may return watch file lists that contain POSIX paths on Windows systems. This can cause the file watcher to not correctly invalidate files that need to be processed during a rebuild. All watch files are now normalized prior to being added to the in-memory cache to avoid this problem.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): normalize paths in loader cache with esbuild" (#25481)

I tested his minimal repro, still having the same problem on my machine. Also tested 2 of my production apps, same result.

### Minimal Reproduction

https://github.com/leon/bug-angular-esbuild-tailwind

This exact repro from https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/25400 worked for the issue reporter but not for me.

```

Issues.Title: Angular16 esbuild extremely slow
Issues.Body: ### Command build, serve ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description Wit the advent of Angular 16 I figured I'd give the esbuild builder another try after it not providing much benefit for my project with Angular 15 and initially not working with angular-material back then. Fully on v16, the esbuild does run. However, instead of faster it is extremely slow compared to the default builder. I'm talking 658s for `ng-serve --proxy-config proxy.config.json` vs 119831**ms** with the default builder And 694s for `ng build -c=production --subresource-integrity` vs 149683**ms** with the default builder At the moment, I'm in the dark as to what could be causing this issue. The only possible hunch would be the iban commonjs module? ### Minimal Reproduction The only things I have changed were in the configuration: adding the `-esbuild` suffix to the specified builder and importing the material icons font via the styles array instead of via an scss file. Package JSON: ``` { "name": "esl-apor-portalweb", "version": "0.0.0", "scripts": { "ng": "ng", "start": "ng serve", "start:proxy": "ng serve --proxy-config proxy.config.json", "build": "ng build", "build:prod": "ng build -c=production --subresource-integrity", "watch": "ng build --watch --configuration development", "test": "jest --runInBand", "test:watch": "jest --watch --changedSince master", "test:local": "jest --coverage", "test:changed": "jest --coverage --changedSince master", "docs:json": "compodoc -p ./tsconfig.json -e json -d .", "storybook": "ng run esl-apor-portalweb:storybook", "build-storybook": "ng run esl-apor-portalweb:build-storybook", "prepare": "husky install", "lint": "ng lint --cache", "generate:version": "echo 'todo'" }, "private": true, "dependencies": { "@angular/animations": "^16.1.3", "@angular/cdk": "16.1.3", "@angular/common": "^16.1.3", "@angular/compiler": "^16.1.3", "@angular/core": "^16.1.3", "@angular/forms": "^16.1.3", "@angular/material": "16.1.3", "@angular/material-luxon-adapter": "^16.1.3", "@angular/platform-browser": "^16.1.3", "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^16.1.3", "@angular/router": "^16.1.3", "@ngx-translate/core": "^15.0.0", "@ngx-translate/http-loader": "^8.0.0", "esl-apor-portalapi-v1-api": "^1.3.0", "iban": "^0.0.14", "luxon": "^3.3.0", "material-icons": "^1.13.8", "rxjs": "~7.8.1", "tslib": "^2.6.0", "zone.js": "~0.13.1" }, "devDependencies": { "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "^16.1.2", "@angular-eslint/builder": "16.0.3", "@angular-eslint/eslint-plugin": "16.0.3", "@angular-eslint/eslint-plugin-template": "16.0.3", "@angular-eslint/schematics": "16.0.3", "@angular-eslint/template-parser": "16.0.3", "@angular/cli": "~16.1.2", "@angular/compiler-cli": "^16.1.3", "@chiragrupani/karma-chromium-edge-launcher": "^2.3.1", "@compodoc/compodoc": "^1.1.21", "@storybook/addon-essentials": "^7.0.24", "@storybook/addon-interactions": "^7.0.24", "@storybook/addon-links": "@types/node": "^20.3.2", "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "^5.60.1", "@typescript-eslint/parser": "^5.60.1", "css-loader": "^6.8.1", "eslint": "^8.43.0", "eslint-plugin-rxjs": "^5.0.3", "projects", "projects": { "esl-apor-portalweb": { "projectType": "application", "schematics": { "@schematics/angular:component": { "style": "scss", "displayBlock": true } }, "root": "", "sourceRoot": "@storybook/angular:start-storybook", "options": { "browserTarget": "esl-apor-portalweb:build", "port": 6006, "compodoc": false, "configDir": ".storybook" } }, "build-storybook": { "builder": "@storybook/angular:build-storybook", "options": { "browserTarget": "esl-apor-portalweb:build", "outputDir": "__storybook", "quiet": true, "compodoc": false } } } } }, "schematics": { 5.1.6 ``` ### Anything else relevant? I am working on a Windows VDI via Citrix as mandated by the client, which is considerably slower than my own machine. However, the difference is nowhere near big enough to explan a 650+ second ng-serve command. Package manager is PNPM My app is split up in - the start/general code (services, pipes, interceptors, first screen components, ...) - 2 regular modules (layout, shared) - 3 lazy loaded modules (1 per screen; they all import shared & layout) Packages that may be relevant: - @angular/material - @storybook/angular - jest-preset-angular - iban - luxon - material-icons - @ngx-translate - an auto-generated library package aimed at Angular 15.x for our api calls

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use absolute watch paths for postcss dependency messages
Issues.Body: Postcss's directory dependency message can use a glob pattern to reflect that multiple files within a given directory should be watched. When calculated the complete file set, the paths must be absolute to ensure that the watch system correctly invalidates the stylesheet being processed.

### [`v0.18.11`](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​01811)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/compare/v0.18.10...v0.18.11)

-   Fix a TypeScript code generation edge case ([#​3199](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/3199))

    This release fixes a regression in version 0.18.4 where using a TypeScript `namespace` that exports a `class` declaration combined with `--keep-names` and a `--target` of `es2021` or earlier could cause esbuild to export the class from the namespace using an incorrect name (notice the assignment to `X2._Y` vs. `X2.Y`):

    ```ts
    // Original code

    // Old output (with --keep-names --target=es2021)
    var X;
    ((X2) => {
      const _Y = class _Y {
      };
      __name(_Y, "Y");
      let Y = _Y;
      X2._Y = _Y;
    })(X || (X = {}));

    // New output (with --keep-names --target=es2021)
    var X;
    ((X2) => {
      const _Y = class _Y {
      };
      __name(_Y, "Y");
      let Y = _Y;
      X2.Y = _Y;
    })(X || (X = {}));
    ```

</details>

<details>
<summary>mrmlnc/fast-glob</summary>

### [`v3.3.0`](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/releases/tag/3.3.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/compare/3.2.12...3.3.0)

> **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/compare/3.2.12...3.3.0

##### 🚀 Improvements

**Method aliases**

New methods (`glob`, `globSync`, `globStream`) have been added in addition to the current methods (default import, `sync`, `stream`), which eliminate the need to rename the method when importing. In addition, an `async` alias has been added for the default import, which makes it possible to use this packet with ESM.

**Method to convert paths to globs**

A new method (`convertPathToPattern`) has been added in this release to convert a path to a pattern. The primary goal is to enable users to avoid processing Windows paths in each location where this package is used by utilities from third-party packages.

See more details in the [pull request](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/pull/392).

##### 🐛 Bug fixes

-   In the past, we mishandled patterns that contained slashes when the `baseNameMatch` option was enabled, which went against the documented behavior. ([#​312](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/312))
-   Several problems with matching patterns that contain brace expansion have been resolved.  The primary issue solved is when the pattern has duplicate slashes after it is expanded ([#​394](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/394)), or the `micromatch` package does not correctly generate a regular expression ([#​365](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/365)).
-   All negative patterns will now have the `dot` option enabled when matching paths. Previously, the `!**/*` patterns did not exclude hidden files (start with a dot). ([#​343](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/343))
-   The issue that led to duplicates in the results when overlapping or duplicate patterns were present among the patterns has been fixed. At the moment, we are only talking about leading dot. Other cases are not included. For example, running with the patterns `['./file.md', 'file.md', '*']` will now only include `file.md` once in the results. ([#​190](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/issues/190))

##### 📖 Documentation

A [clarifying note](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/blob/master/README.md#concurrency) has been added for the `concurrency` option, which provides more detailed information about the Thread Pool utilization.

##### ⚙️ Infrastructure

-   The benchmark in CI is now running on Node.js 20.
-   The benchmark now uses the public package [bencho](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/bencho) instead of an in-house implementation. You may want to try this solution for your packages and provide feedback.

##### 🥇 New Contributors

-   [@​josh-hemphill](https://togithub.com/josh-hemphill) made their first contribution in [https://github.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/pull/383](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/pull/383)
-   [@​mairaw](https://togithub.com/mairaw) made their first contribution in [https://github.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/pull/401](https://togithub.com/mrmlnc/fast-glob/pull/401)

</details>

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use built-in CSS vendor prefixing in esbuild
Issues.Body: As of esbuild v0.18.9, vendor prefixing of CSS is now supported. The esbuild target option is generated from a project's browserslist and the vendor prefixing will reflect the configured browsers for a project. This improvement allows for the removal of the postcss autoprefixer plugin from the build pipeline. This can provide a performance benefit for projects especially when project stylesheets contain nothing that would require prefixing since postcss processing can potentially be skipped completely.

Issues.Title: bug(cdk/menu): sub menu with disabled items only is not closed when other sub menu is opened
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

This issue only occurs when using the menu with a keyboard. 

If in a cdk menu, a sub menu is opened with ONLY disabled children, and then another sub menu is opened, that sub menu with the disabled children remains open.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-stnsdh?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html
Steps to reproduce:
1. focus "Open Menu" button
2. press space / open menu
3. navigate to menu item "With disabled child" using arrow keys
4. open sub menu by pressing arrow right
5. navigate to "With enabled child" by pressing arrow up
6. open sub menu by pressing arrow right


### Expected Behavior

Sub menu with disabled child is closed

### Actual Behavior

Sub menu with disabled child is NOT closed

### Environment

- Angular: 15
- CDK/Material: 15
- Browser(s): Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk/menu): sub menu with disabled items only is not closed when other sub menu is opened" (#27403)

Issues.Title: bug(Slider): Page Up/ Page Down buttons increase value but not by 10 steps
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.2.7

### Description

According to the documentation, the slider should increase the value by 10 steps when using Page Up/Page Down keys.
It instead increases/decreases by a different number of steps.
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/17402311/ff4eced7-3134-4913-8a04-f086ebbc8f2c)
![slidermaterialissuepageupdown](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/17402311/38a787cd-dbe2-48b4-9847-4eed9b60eef3)


### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: 500 Internal server error for Stackblitz.... but the issue can be reproduced on the official Material demo
Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to: https://material.angular.io/components/slider/examples#slider-configurable
2. Type '9999' as the max value
3. Use the Page Up/Page Down keys to increase/decrease value


### Expected Behavior

The value is increased/decreased by 10 steps.

### Actual Behavior

The value is increased/decreased by 1000 steps for max value 9999, 
the value is increased/decreased by 100 steps for max value 1000,
not by 10 steps, like in the documentation.

The step is not set, so I assumed a default of 1 x 10 = 10 steps.

Using the arrows, the value is increased/decreased correctly, by 1 step.
Happens on both angular 15 and 16.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.9
- CDK/Material: 15.2.9
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Slider): Page Up/ Page Down buttons increase value but not by 10 steps" (#27402)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk/menu): Mac OS VoiceOver cannot operate menu
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14

### Description

Using VoiceOver on Mac OS, I am unable to open a CDK-enabled menu using the standard VoiceOver key combination for a button (Ctrl-Option-Space).

The same applies to selecting menu items after the menu is open (if opened some other way first).

### Reproduction

Go to the CDK menu examples page: https://material.angular.io/cdk/menu/examples using Mac OS, with VoiceOver enabled. Tab to the button under "Google Docs Menu Bar" or "Menu with Standalone Trigger" or "Stateful Menu with Standalone Trigger".

VoiceOver announces "To display a list of options, press Ctrl-Option-Space". Press this key combination.

### Expected Behavior

Pressing Ctrl-Option-Space should open the menu. This is the standard VoiceOver command for activating any button or link.

### Actual Behavior

Pressing Ctrl-Option-Space has no effect.

The same occurs for v15: https://v15.material.angular.io/cdk/menu/examples

But it works as expected for v14: https://v14.material.angular.io/cdk/menu/examples

It also works as expected for the latest Material menu: https://material.angular.io/components/menu/examples rather than the CDK.

### Environment

- Angular: 15, 16
- CDK: 15, 16
- Browser(s): latest Chrome, Edge, Firefox, or Safari
- Operating System: Mac OS (reproduced on both latest 13.4.1 and the much older 10.13.6)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(cdk/menu): Mac OS VoiceOver cannot operate menu" (#27376)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/menu): control + option + space not working on VoiceOver
Issues.Body:
In #26296 I added a condition in the click handler for menu triggers and menu items to skip clicks dispatched by the keyboard so that they don't trigger the menu twice. The problem is that this also ends up ignoring the default keyboard shortcut that VoiceOver mentions should be used to trigger the menu (Control + Option + Space), because it ends up being dispatched as a plain `click` event and it doesn't trigger the `keydown` event at all.

These changes address the issue by removing the previous condition and inferring whether the event will trigger a click by looking at it and the element it's coming from.

Fixes #27376.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(cdk/menu): control + option + space not working on VoiceOver" (#27401)

Issues.Title: mat-button-toggle-group incorrectly displays selection when used with reactive forms framework
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

`mat-button-toggle-group` incorrectly displays selection when it is used with:
* `mat-button-toggle`s which can change during the `mat-button-toggle-group`'s lifespan,
* the reactive forms framework

---

The issue seems to come down to `mat-button-toggle-group` relying on its internal `_rawValue` field for determining selection of buttons that are being added/removed, and the fact that user interactions never update the `_rawValue` field: https://github.com/angular/components/blob/06f8544e7b7bf8b2cc279a2e30d123c7d74804e1/src/material/button-toggle/button-toggle.ts#L129

---

The workaround I was able to find for this is to specify not only:
```
<mat-button-toggle-group [formControl]="control">
</mat-button-toggle-group>
```
but also provide the `[value]` input:
```
<mat-button-toggle-group [formControl]="control" [value]="control.value">
</mat-button-toggle-group>
```
It seems to poke `mat-button-toggle-group` just enough to make it work, but it should obviously not be needed.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/7ytnse?file=src%2Fexample%2Fbutton-toggle-exclusive-example.html

Steps to reproduce:

1. Click "Last button"
2. Click "Toggle button values"
3. Click "Toggle button values"
4. Click "Toggle button values"

### Expected Behavior

After each of the steps, the "Last button" is selected - as dictated by the FormControl's value.

### Actual Behavior

After step 3, "A" is selected. After step 4 nothing is selected.

### Environment

- Angular: 16.1.1
- CDK/Material: 16.1.3
- Browser(s): Chrome 114.0.5735.133
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): modified Debian
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "mat-button-toggle-group incorrectly displays selection when used with reactive forms framework" (#27397)

Issues.Title: fix(material/button-toggle): not preserving value if preselected option is removed
Issues.Body:
The button toggle keeps track of the raw value to determine which option is preselected on init. The problem is that the raw value is never updated so if the user selects a different option, removes the preselected one and then re-adds it, the initial preselected option will become selected.

Fixes #27397.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/button-toggle): not preserving value if preselected option is removed" (#27398)

Issues.Title: feat(a11y): Make CdkFocusTrap and other a11y directives/components standalone
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Currently the full A11yModule has to be loaded for simple CdKTrapFocus feature and others.

Is there any timeline for this kind of refactoring? Or is this not possible with the current implementation of the @angular/cdk package? I can see that there are two PRs untouched since December 2022 for migrating other directives to standalone directives.

### Use Case

A standalone directive would allow attaching CdkTrapFocus to be attached to the `hostDirectives` feature introduced in Angular 15. This would reduce complexity as currently a dynamically attached component (like a context menu) needs an additional inner wrapper div to be able to attach the CdkTrapFocus directive to it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(a11y): Make CdkFocusTrap and other a11y directives/components standalone " (#27388)

Issues.Title: bundle size significantly larger for experimental vs legacy components
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description I know this is work in progress, but when I compare the bundle size of the legacy components vs the experimental ones, the experimental ones are significantly larger (50% larger, in my project). I've attached source-map-explorer that shows the difference for form-field, button, dialog, expansion & icon. ### Reproduction StackBlitz link: Steps to reproduce: 1. Build project w/ material legacy components 2.Build project w/ material experimental components 3. Compare bundle size using source-map-explorer ... experimental bundle size is much larger. ### Expected Behavior I expect legacy and experimental bundle sizes to be close in size ### Actual Behavior Experimental bundle sizes are much larger. ### Environment - Angular: 16.2.0-next.0 - CDK/Material: 16.2.0-next.1 - Browser(s): N/A - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): MacOS

Issues.Title: fix(material/menu): prevent menu styles from leaking to other components
Issues.Body:
The menu theme was including the MDC list styles directly at the root of the theme which caused to leak into other components like `mat-list`.

The mixins will be removed in #27377, however currently the screenshot tests of a lot of internal targets assume that the leaky styles will be there which breaks the presubmit of #27377.

These changes introduce a *temporary* wrapper class around the mixins so that the incorrect screenshots can be approved before trying to land #27377.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/menu): prevent menu styles from leaking to other components" (#27378)

Issues.Title: bug(InteractivityChecker): Seeing a lot of warning in unit test 'Element matching ‘[cdkFocusInitial]'
Issues.Body:
### Description

We are using a library modal component which uses cdkFocusInitial in one of its div element having tabindex set to -1. Modal component is being used in around ~20 of our components. While running unit test, we are getting a lot of warning 'Element matching ‘[cdkFocusInitial]'. I think isFocusable check of InteractivityChecker is failing as the modal is not open initially and is failing isVisible.

What is the need of showing this warning, There is no elegant way of suppressing this warning.

### Expected Behavior

Lots of warning with 'Element matching ‘[cdkFocusInitial]'

### Actual Behavior

Warning 'Element matching ‘[cdkFocusInitial]' should not be shown, or a better way should be provided to suppress the warning.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.2
- CDK/Material: 15.2.2
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(InteractivityChecker): Seeing a lot of warning in unit test 'Element matching ‘[cdkFocusInitial]'" (#27389)

Issues.Title: bug(MatTable): Flex tables do not correctly expand height of footer row
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

V14

### Description

When using footer rows with flex tables, the footer row height will not expand like the header rows do.

Suspect this is because of an [incorrect CSS selector in material/table/table.scss](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/de7c3dbd084f84cc6601830e3639c679a91bbbd3/src/material/table/table.scss#L135).

Selector:

```css
.mat-mdc-table mat-footer-row.mat-mdc-footer-cell {
   ...
}
```

Should be:

```css
.mat-mdc-table mat-footer-row.mat-mdc-footer-row {
   ...
}
```

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-dqhwvz?file=src%2Fapp%2Ftable-flex-basic-example.css

Steps to reproduce:

1. Angular Material table example should have X in second column for both header and footer
2. X in footer is clipped top and bottom
3. Uncomment CSS selector in table-flex-basic-example.css to fix problem


### Expected Behavior

Expect footer row to auto expand height in a similar way to header row.

### Actual Behavior

Footer does not auto expand height.

### Environment

- Angular: 16.1.3
- CDK/Material: 16.1.3
- Browser(s): Firefox, Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatTable): Flex tables do not correctly expand height of footer row" (#27387)

Issues.Title: Remove synchronous loading example from Google Maps readme
Issues.Body: [The first example](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/google-maps/README.md#loading-the-api) for loading the API in the Google Maps readme uses a synchronous `script` tag to load the API which is discouraged by the Google Maps team, because it loads everything up-front, even if a map isn't on the page. It can also slow down the entire if the Google Maps script takes longer to load. We should remove the example from our docs.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove synchronous loading example from Google Maps readme" (#27374)

Issues.Title: Use importLibrary API to load Google Maps
Issues.Body:
Google Maps has an API that requires a minimal JavaScript snippet to allow for the full API to be loaded asynchronously. We should consider supporting it since it'll improve the DX of the Google Maps package. Note that using it would involve some refactoring to turn the existing synchronous call sites into asynchronous ones.

Docs for the `importLibrary` API: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/load-maps-js-api#dynamic-library-import
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Use importLibrary API to load Google Maps" (#27373)
